forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: A slight chance of drizzle. Mostly cloudy, with a low around 54. West southwest wind around 14 mph, with gusts as high as 18 mph. Chance of precipitation is 20%.

forecast.name: Monday
forecast.shortForecast: Slight Chance Drizzle then Mostly Sunny
forecast.detailedForecast: A slight chance of drizzle before 11am. Mostly sunny. High near 64, with temperatures falling to around 61 in the afternoon. West southwest wind 12 to 23 mph, with gusts as high as 29 mph. Chance of precipitation is 20%.

weather_report:
In Downtown San Francisco, the morning greets us with a hint of moisture lingering in the air, whispered remnants of drizzle still tracing the skyline. The day is draped in a soft, mottled blanket of clouds, casting a subdued light that drifts delicately between the golden edges of the city’s iconic architecture. As the clock inches toward midday, the faint promise of blue skies begins to unfurl, although it will take its time to reveal a true sun-drenched glow. Winds gusting from the west-southwest will tease with a refreshing coolness, urging light sweaters or jackets to accompany your morning coffee run.

As the afternoon unfolds, the temperature will dip softly from the high of 64, settling into the more temperate embrace of 61. While this warmth isn't particularly fierce, it beckons you outside to savor the vibrant life of the streets. A stroll down to the waterfront could be a delightful way to embrace the day's evolving character, with the gentle sway of the bay and the distant echoes of city life providing a melodic backdrop. For those seeking a quieter moment, perhaps a small café nestled in one of the city’s many corners will serve as a peaceful respite, perfectly paired with a book or a conversation with a friend under the fading light of the day.
